column15: When looking for a melanoma, I focus on the pigmentation of the lesion, the absence of pattern symmetry, color uniformity. Then I look for specific signs: blue-white veil, multiple brown dots, pseudopods, radial streaming, scarlike depigmentation, peripheral block dots/globules, 5 to 6 colors,...

column16: Globules: Dermoscopic globules are round or oval-shaped structures seen within a lesion. They can vary in color and size and may provide important diagnostic clues.
column17: Structureless Areas: These areas lack specific patterns or structures and are typically associated with melanoma or other malignant lesions.
